website_summaries.verdict: A simple solution of vehicle refrigerant best used for regular maintenance of the air conditioning system.
pros: Designed to effectively repair minor leaks in the AC system lines
Compatible with a variety of materials such as plastic and rubber commonly found on hoses, O-rings, seals, and gaskets
Eliminates moisture buildup and acid from AC system
cons: Does not drastically decrease the temperature output of air conditioning

customer_reviews.title: "FANTASTIC" !!!
customer_reviews.text: THIS PRODUCT DOES EVERYTHING THAT IT STATES IN THE ADVERTISING STATEMENTS ON THE CANS LABEL. COLD AIR ALMOST IMMEDIATELY AND IT DOES FEEL A BIT COLDER AS WELL. THE EASE OF RECHARGING AND MAINTAINING THE FREON LEVEL IS SO SIMPLE THAT I FIND MYSELF CHECKING IT ABOUT ONCE A MONTH. THANKS FOR A GREAT PRODUCT THAT ACTUALLY WORKS !!
customer_reviews.author: GARY LEHL

customer_reviews.title: I live in the south Texas to be exact this is the product you need for the humidity and moisture
customer_reviews.text: I tried a cheaper version of this product that did not work I ordered this spent the money which cost more and his product made by air really cold especially living in the south in Texas where it’s humid and muggy all the time this product is amazing and you pay for what you get for
customer_reviews.author: carla

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my AC blowing cold air
customer_reviews.text: This review is for the Interdynamics Arctic Freeze Synthetic Automotive Refrigerant R-134a (12 ounces). I have been using this brand of refrigerant for some time now with great results and no problems. What can I say? It works. I have however been able to get this same brand from retailers other than Amazon for a much lower price.
customer_reviews.author: D. Houston

customer_reviews.title: Good product helped my civic ac run cooler
customer_reviews.text: Yes it works and cools faster. I was able to seal the leak and it seem to be cooling they see much faster. I’ve owned this car for over 10 years so I can tell.
customer_reviews.author: Rafay K

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Air unit sat for 10 years unused. Had a small leak. It’s not leaked at all since adding this product.
customer_reviews.author: CLTractorParts

customer_reviews.title: ... is the 134a auto air conditioning product that I like the best
customer_reviews.text: This is the 134a auto air conditioning product that I like the best. I own five Volvos that have U.S. installed (notoriously below average) air conditioners. Artic Freeze works in these systems. Very cold.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Rentz

customer_reviews.title: serves the purpose. not sure it is worth the ...
customer_reviews.text: serves the purpose. not sure it is worth the extra expense. although it is supposed to have a leak preventative (seals leaks), it still leaked out over a couple of months.
customer_reviews.author: DANNY R SCARBOROUGH

customer_reviews.title: Nice cool A/C! Again. ;-)
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after my A/C failed to cool. Took almost two cans to get it going but now I get nice cool air. Time will tell on the leak sealer but the price at Amazon was much better than the local Auto store! Not the best way to fix it but for now I have nice cool A/C!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Frigid!
customer_reviews.text: Put this in my 1988 Mustang, which had no Freon. Used slightly more than one can, and the A/C is frigid! Has held up through the summer, so if there were any leaks, they've been plugged. This Freon has acid reducer, which acidity is inherent in using 134a, so this will make you A/C components last longer.
customer_reviews.author: JAKE

customer_reviews.title: Best refrigerant out there!
customer_reviews.text: Best refrigerant for the price, I only use synthetic refrigerant in my cars now and can really see the difference. Much needed for those hot summer days in the south.
customer_reviews.author: David Croll

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Made more of a difference as compared to the cheap R134a stuff. People say the stuff is all the same so go with the cheapest....but this stuff is better!! I swear by it! Sometimes tin my BMW 330ci the air is TOO COLD on my face. What a good problem to have on a hot summer day!
customer_reviews.author: Simple Man

customer_reviews.title: Good so Far
customer_reviews.text: This stuff did the job at a decent price. I used it as a refill after replacing the compressor and some other parts. I'd get it again if I needed to top it off. Just a note if you're not used to doing this kind of work, it really does take a long time to get into the system (be patient).
customer_reviews.author: StSky

customer_reviews.title: Works great after buying the original can with the applicator with ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great after buying the original can with the applicator with it. But it does take more than one can to charge the system for 1999 Chevy Blazer. I think it took 2 cans and the air was way cold. Saves a ton of money from taking it to an auto shop and paying the high labor costs.
customer_reviews.author: L. Culp

customer_reviews.title: So far so good, seems to cool faster and sealed a very ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, seems to cool faster and sealed a very small leak, worth the price because 2 cans of standard r134 leaked out while this held
customer_reviews.author: bert

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I have used this on several cars, it actually cools better than regular refrigerants. I live in south florida where the weather is really hot and humid, I topped off the a/c in my tundra and the outlet temperatures goes all the way to 40 degrees F.
customer_reviews.author: Lorenzo

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Had a slow ac leak and was refilling once a month, used this and it's been over a year now, still blowing cold, great stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Premium 134a
customer_reviews.text: My go-to brand of 134a available to order. This worked great for my breathing new life into the A/C system for my 2006 Mercury. The Arctic freeze brand just seems to get colder than other brands.
customer_reviews.author: S. QUINN

customer_reviews.title: GOOD stuff!
customer_reviews.text: It is TOO cold! Have to turn it down! I love it and recommend especially on a new flush or system rebiuld!
customer_reviews.author: golfmann

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is the best that I've tried. Works great...price is great from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: electraglideflh

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Stuff worked great to charger my A/C after a new compressor.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Clark

customer_reviews.title: had to buy extra
customer_reviews.text: had to buy this to finish fill the system now I have air but as of now I don't need it because the temp hasn't been warm enough to wooy about anyway this product works
customer_reviews.author: none

customer_reviews.title: Good for a health system, poor for any amount of leaks
customer_reviews.text: I had a minor AC leak. So minor that a recharge from the shop would last all summer. When I tried using cans instead of going to the shop, I quickly realized that it talks alot of cans to really make a difference (4+) If you have any leaks, best to get it fixed and skip the cans altogether. If you are sure you don't have a leak, then a can or two might be reasonable. AND...anything that claims to stop leaks is a gamble and a half, so don't depend on it when deciding your purchase.
customer_reviews.author: NikNak

customer_reviews.title: Arctic R-134a
customer_reviews.text: Bought three cans , Really Works great , great price and delivered fast. I know where I will keep buying this from know on. Thank You
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stuff
customer_reviews.text: Seems to get cold quick, got rid of compressor noise
customer_reviews.author: Stephen & Marie Hobbs

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Our 2003 Corolla A/C wasn't getting quite as cold as it used to, but one can of this fixed the problem in about 15 minutes. $12 vs $100 at the dealer, what's not to like! One thing to note is the item is the can only, so you will need a charge hose. Luckily I had one left over from when I recharged my work truck so I didn't need one, but if you do, look for the "Interdynamics Arctic Freeze with Reusable Trigger Dispenser & Gauge"
customer_reviews.author: NCSTec

customer_reviews.title: Cold
customer_reviews.text: Works great. My car needs just a bit every year to get to optimal cooling.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce F

customer_reviews.title: Overall a good product. Exactly what you'd expect to get
customer_reviews.text: Overall a good product. Exactly what you'd expect to get. Cooled the ac system right down.. still going strong months later.
customer_reviews.author: joe ballangee

customer_reviews.title: Cools really fast
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if all refrigerant are the same but this brand in particular I did feel it getting cold within 5 seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Stiak Haq

customer_reviews.title: Works great wish they sell larger volume cans
customer_reviews.text: It charged the system just fine, and immediately i can feel the colder air blown out of AC Vent. Wish they offered a larger volume can as my system seems to need more than 2 cans to recharge back to normal pressure. My wife's car is about 10 years old and the AC system was never serviced before, the pressure in the system was at abt 25psi, and with one can added, it bumped the system up about 5psi to 30psi (recommended 40-50psi) so definitely need to order more for recharge.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonAholic

customer_reviews.title: Works great, helped with leak.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after getting some other brand with leak fix that didn't last long (about 2 weeks). This is still holding and it's been a few months now.
customer_reviews.author: David M Anderson

customer_reviews.title: sealed the leak
customer_reviews.text: After trying another brand that diodn't work used this and it sealed the leak and the A/C is cranking cold now!
customer_reviews.author: DACDOG

customer_reviews.title: Great 134a
customer_reviews.text: Great 134a refrigerant. gets cold really quick. Used for a quick recharge. No issues.
customer_reviews.author: Ponch

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: At first I was skeptical about, but over all this is great reliable stuff, for a great PRICE. can't beat that.
customer_reviews.author: DIY

customer_reviews.title: Good freon
customer_reviews.text: Worked as advertised! Hope it fixes the slow leak. Time will tell
customer_reviews.author: Thrifty Old Coot

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Love the price. There $23 at my local auto store.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to inject into your ac system and cools nicely.
customer_reviews.author: TommyBoy

customer_reviews.title: THIS PRODUCT PERFORMS
customer_reviews.text: I'm usually skeptical about products that make claims that could be exaggerated. I have been very pleasantly surprised that this product has lived up to all it's claims in both of our automobiles. I've not had to add additional refrigerant to either vehicle since the initial charges and both vehicles' AC units put out colder air than previously. This product works.
customer_reviews.author: Jack S.

customer_reviews.title: Sealed the leaks.
customer_reviews.text: Used two of these to fill my AC that the repair shop wanted $1200 to fix my leak. 4 months later AC is still blowing cold air!
customer_reviews.author: chya_go

customer_reviews.title: Very good product!
customer_reviews.text: Hires Automotive gave me a perfect deal and the freight was swift! Very pleased with the product, as everyone already are saying here. Great for those leaks that are hard/impossible to find.
customer_reviews.author: Robert  Jansson

customer_reviews.title: I had very poor cooling performance in a 2007 Corvette
customer_reviews.text: In a freshly evacuated system, I filled the system by weight. The low side pressure was correct according to the chart on the can. None the less, I had very poor cooling performance in a 2007 Corvette. The high side pressure was way too low, offering no where near enough differential to work properly. I then evacuated this product and filled the system with plain-Jane 134a from local auto parts store and the AC system worked flawlessly. And when I say this product offered poor cooling, I mean it couldn't keep up on a day of only 75F. How useless would that be come August in Texas?
customer_reviews.author: S. Hurst

customer_reviews.title: ALWAYS WORKS GREAT
customer_reviews.text: EASY TO DO, AC BACK TO BEING FREEZING COLD. I HAD A DEPLETED SUPPLY OF FREON AS THE COMPRESSOR SHUTS ITSELF DOWN WHEN THAT HAPPENS TO PROTECT IT.
customer_reviews.author: Drewski

customer_reviews.title: Super Cold! Recharged my CR-V and went from no ...
customer_reviews.text: Super Cold ! Recharged my CR-V and went from no AC to Arctic Cold ! I loaded the system to 20 PSI. I can was enough. Make sure to shake it upside down as you charge ! Keep shaking it through the whole process !!!
customer_reviews.author: MIT Guy

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be great
customer_reviews.text: Just did my truck and my friends truck. I used two bottles of normal r134a and then one bottole of the artic freeze.. I didn't want to load the system up with too much "sealant".. .Not sure how true the claims that it gets colder faster..etc. But I now have 58 degree air conditioning! LOVE IT! Before hand I was just around 80-90 degree air conditioning depending on the temp outside... I'm a happy camper. This is about the same cost as if you got it at Advance so it might be easier to get it there... Shipping took a while from this vender.. actually TOO long in my opinion... -Nigel
customer_reviews.author: Nigel

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: This refrigerant seems to have cured the gremlins in my system. As others have commented, it seems to cool better too. Great shipping as well. What's not to like!
customer_reviews.author: Barry D Whitley

customer_reviews.title: Great worked well
customer_reviews.text: I do like this product, it helps get colder faster, I put it in an older chevy 84 van, and it worked like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: michael in malibu

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding!!!
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding product and seller!!!!!! I am impressed and will order more when needed!! Would recommend to anyone who needs to improve their air conditioner's performance :)
customer_reviews.author: Jerome C. Williams Jr

customer_reviews.title: 1991 honda accord
customer_reviews.text: Awesome price for a great product. My 1991 retrofit Honda is cold as ice. It's even colder than using R12.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hoy

customer_reviews.title: It's refrigerant
customer_reviews.text: Product worked well for me and my 2000 Nissan frontier. I have a new Calsonic AC compressor and use this with FJC2487 Pag 100 and have had no issues. Temp goes down to about 30°F in the 98°F and 95% humidity of this Mississippi summer.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: ICE COLD!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the gun and I recharge my car it made a huge differences excellent job.. excellent product. You need to be patients when you recharge it takes 20 minutes for the gas to make a recharge.
customer_reviews.author: Nikolaos Hatzopoulos

customer_reviews.title: artic r-134a ultra synthetic freeze refrigerant-12
customer_reviews.text: it work real good. my air is coming out cold again. I would use it again, its easy to use and it work perfect thank you bernie
customer_reviews.author: bernie karlovich

customer_reviews.title: one of the best r-134a
customer_reviews.text: one of the best r-134a freon I have ever used. it gets really cold. And makes compressor run quiet. (:
customer_reviews.author: GARY ARNETT

customer_reviews.title: Freezer in my truck
customer_reviews.text: Used Arctic freeze on my 2003 ford Explorer limited to fill a system after a compressor and accumulator replacement and I'm telling you..... Temps coming out from my vents are freezing..... 38f with 89 degrees outside with 70-80% humidity. Recommended
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Interdynamics (AF-3) Arctic R-134a Ultra freon
customer_reviews.text: this Freon works so much better and faster than normal Freon I wont use anything else it also doesn't leak out as fast so I have noticed in my truck. AGAIN it works better and cools down faster but it does cost a little more!!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: After using nearly the whole bottle my ac went from ...
customer_reviews.text: After using nearly the whole bottle my ac went from blowing warm air for the past year and a half to freezing cold instantly. It's lasted all summer without any issues at all. I drive a 1997 Honda Accord EX-L Coupe.
customer_reviews.author: VeeTeeF

customer_reviews.title: arctic R 134a
customer_reviews.text: Did not seem that cool and did not stop a leak which must be present in my 28 year old 911.
customer_reviews.author: wndsrf

customer_reviews.title: Good for R134a conversions
customer_reviews.text: Good stuff for R134a conversions . I consistently get acceptable cool down temps and 38 degrees discharge temp out the dash in 100 degree weather.
customer_reviews.author: Trailer Trash

customer_reviews.title: ac refill
customer_reviews.text: refill is very affordable now. saves you hundreds and has the same effect... worh the price and puncuality is great . A+
customer_reviews.author: giuseppe calogero

customer_reviews.title: It works like Charm
customer_reviews.text: i said i should give the Artic Freeze a try,but to my surprise it worked wonders,it gave me a colder air just as it claimed and it did that faster,i recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Yomi Olaogun

customer_reviews.title: Be aware of contents
customer_reviews.text: Didn't fix my leak, but that's OK, you can't expect a miracle. I thought it was worth a try. What I don't like is the fact that this has oil in it. It is in the fine print on the can, but I don't see anything in this description about oil. Now, the thought might be that if you are losing refrigerant, you are loosing oil. OK, maybe so, but after putting two cans of this into my system, it looks to me that there is way too much oil in there. Just be aware!
customer_reviews.author: Stevie G

customer_reviews.title: My compressor leaked like a sieve
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for a few seconds ... the time it took my compressor to leak all the fluid. Fast delivery and I'm sure it would've worked great and will work great once I get the system up to snuff. Fast delivery ... I recommend 100%
customer_reviews.author: Dartagnon Puissant

customer_reviews.title: You will be pleased!
customer_reviews.text: The a/c in my nearly 20 year old vehicle needs to be recharged yearly due to a leak no one can find. Not only did the Artic Freeze make the system run colder than it ever has, it seemed to lessen the rate of the leak over time. I was impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Just need to add a can to my a/c system as I'm too cheap to pay a professional to find and repair the leak.
customer_reviews.author: pontoon4me

customer_reviews.title: It works, but unsure if it made the air colder.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if it actually works or not. I have to retro fit my '92 Civic. I used regular R134a from a different brand it was cold then went warm. I decided to then try this and to replace the AC filter. It turned cold again but I'm not sure if it made the air colder.
customer_reviews.author: Tofu

customer_reviews.title: Charged my car with it and I now have cold AC
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this andfrom Amazon. I did this because the hoses on the ones you buy attached to the can are to short of many cars and for not much more money I got a new tool for the tool box. I've posted a quick video with the process on how to use. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Todd & Melanie

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great. You might need 2 or 3 cans. Its easy to do. Just read instructions. Have car and A/C running to install.
customer_reviews.author: RBaril

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: You have to buy a connector hose to use this. The hose costs more than this can.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Pickett

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: It seemed it worked but it end up making my car blow hot hair.
customer_reviews.author: Ermi
